website_summaries.verdict: Ultra-high read and write speeds for shooting and sending 4K video; some of highest speeds available. Multiple storage capacities.
pros: No other card we considered combines this amount of storage with these speeds, as high as 285 Mbps
Compatible with virtually every modern device
256 GB model lets you shoot a lot of video and images without needing to change cards
cons: May be impractical for occasional users

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine with my Panasonic Lumix GH5 firmware v2.1 at max settings
customer_reviews.text: This worked for me on my Panasonic Lumix GH5 at 4K 400Mbs All-i 30fps 4:2:2 in firmware v2.1. I recorded through the entire card which took about 40 minutes todaywith zero crashes. On a lesser card from the same manufacturer, the card crashed within 10-15 seconds. I'm not aware of a review anywhere for any other card that has zero crashes with maximum settings. Interestingly, this card was released by Amplin this month.﻿ With all of the confusion regarding what cards work with the GH5, I just had to post my experience to try to help.
customer_reviews.author: Arne Odland

customer_reviews.title: Works with GH5 (v2.2 firmware).
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for recording 4K at 400Mbs 4:2:2 10 bit on GH5. Works fine...no issues whatsoever. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: MSD_17

customer_reviews.title: Best Card for 400Mb/sec Panasonic GH5 Recording
customer_reviews.text: This card is perfect for the Panasonic GH5. Using the 400Mb/sec 4K 10bit All-I mode the card never fails. It easily fills the card every time giving the full 1 hour 24 minutes of recording. This is the only 256Gb card I know of that never fails in this mode. It is about the same price as the expensive name brand 128Gb cards, which makes it incredibly cost-effective.
customer_reviews.author: lsherris

customer_reviews.title: Awful Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: Apparently there is terrible quality control with the Amplim cards. I placed the SD card in my camera slot and got an instant error message. I tried it on my computer and it was not even recognized. Very disappointed that I couldn’t even use the card. You definitely get what you pay for here or worse. I have decided to just stick with the Sony Tough series SD cards. I was hoping to be able to save a little and see how these compared. The idea that I might lose all my data after a session shoot or a day out doing landscapes is far too important to gamble with a cheap unreliable card.
customer_reviews.author: Christoph65

customer_reviews.title: This card is junk
customer_reviews.text: This SD Card does not work consistently. I have to constantly format and reformat in my Sony A7R3. The issue is that the when you take images, you cannot view them. You might be able to view 1, but the second image will not show. "Unable To Read" error is shown on camera. I contacted Amazon customer support and Got Sam in Uraguay. He refused to give me any identifcation other than that and was a very poor customer service agent. I am done with Amazon if this does not get resolved. I want a refund for this junk product.
customer_reviews.author: STACY GLASGOW

customer_reviews.title: It offers super quick upload to and from and performs like a ...
customer_reviews.text: This memory card is quite expensive but if you own DSLR it' a must. It offers super quick upload to and from and performs like a champ when recording videos in the highest resolution. Big thumbs up A+
customer_reviews.author: John Woo

customer_reviews.title: Card fail
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. I was pretty pleased with the performance and was using both of them constantly in a Canon 5D and EOS-R. One of them just failed, after only 16 weeks of use. Fortunately it was right after I copied the files to a hard drive, so I lost nothing. But the card failed, I can't format it, the cameras won't read it... I can't use it. I have never, EVER had an SD card fail on me until this one.
customer_reviews.author: Squatty

customer_reviews.title: Not so fast
customer_reviews.text: The 64 GB Amplin card barely outperforms the Kingston 32 GB cards in read speed although it is about twice as fast as the Kingston in write speed. But even that speed is far below the specifications provided. Too slow for the speed I need to capture photos and video without missing the 'next' shot or footage. I'm sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: CT

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up! Works well in Canon 90D. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: I like to do "complete" tests/reviews when I submit for Amazon... on a business trip right now, so I'll simply give a thumbs up at this point I have not performed a full benchmark on the devices. I can state that they work full speed for my Canon 9D: 4K29p and 32mpix@10 frames/sec stills I have seen reviews complaining about the locking switch. I have not played with locking switch very much, but I have not had any issues during 10 or so extractions/insertions. In general, no issues and performance is good enough for my application. Price is MAJOR feature.
customer_reviews.author: David Termohlen

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my A7r3, so far so good, is able to keep up with raw conitnuous shooting of 46MP images and 4K30 video! will buy a second one! I hope this helps - Mr.J
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jurado

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with GH5 All-Intra Shooting
customer_reviews.text: Product works as described. Shot 2 full days with it without any problems. Will buy more soon.
customer_reviews.author: Federico Torres

customer_reviews.title: Works Great. While I haven't formally measured its speed - addendum: it transfers at 55 MB/s
customer_reviews.text: Works Great. While I haven't formally measured its speed, I noticed that file transfers to my computer with my old card rated at 90 MB/s (which actually transferred at about 6 MB/s) is about 10X slower than this card. Not sure of its exact speed but it's definitely fast. Addendum: I've measured it and other cards now: it's much faster than other "ultra" cards: 50-55 megabytes (that's about 400 megabits) per second compared with 10-15 MB/s for other cards rated at "90 MB/s".
customer_reviews.author: Bennett E. WernerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very slow review speed compared to other cards.
customer_reviews.text: Usable space is about half for me, because it gets **very** slow in-camera review. It isn't any faster on burst than anything g else and cuts off with fewer images. Not buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: I haven't had any problems with this card in my Nikon camera shooting video.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any problems with this card in my Nikon camera shooting video. I didn't have any problems with the extreme pro at 95 MB/S either. I am not shooting on 4K, so this card was probably overkill. The price certainly is! Hopefully I will have the need for this in the near future and can update my review.
customer_reviews.author: randy.neale

customer_reviews.title: Not the performance I expected
customer_reviews.text: I create my own videos in 4K and I am into photography as well. I take photos in large formats that require the camera to process large files. I got this product thinking that it would cut the in-camera processing time. The card works just fine. My problem is that I see no significant difference in between this one and the one I replaced which was supposedly 4x slower (95 MB/S). So, do not get me wrong. It may be me or maybe my Sony Alpha is designed to be only so fast. But I doubt it. Overall a good product. Not what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: elzorrocr

customer_reviews.title: A great choice for high end 4k cameras
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Amplim SD card for use on 4K cameras at high transfer speeds (ie 400 MB/s). The first one I ordered has worked great, even up to 400 MB/s. I’ve run it a couple of times in long running shows with no problems. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: alfred hanna

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for GH5 All-i 400Mbps
customer_reviews.text: I didn't perform a write/read test (I have a Prograde card reader and it reads a sustained 220 MB/s), I really don't care though, I just cared about the recording performance on the GH5 All-i 400Mbps recording features, and its perfect. Some of my lesser cards stop after a few seconds. After finding out that this works I purchased 4 of the 256GB cards. I can't speak on the performance for Canon or Sony cameras, but for Panasonic this is the card to get for the GH5
customer_reviews.author: Robert Alvis

customer_reviews.title: It's expensive but well worth it if you take a ...
customer_reviews.text: It's expensive but well worth it if you take a lot of pictures. I'm a photographer so I average 1-2000 photos per month so I need something to transfer my pictures quickly. I use Lightroom CC on my phone so I bought the SD card reader for Iphone so I dont have to sit at my computer as much. I transferred 176 pitures in under 4 minutes! its a very fast card and well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great V60 128GB 2000X SDXC Card
customer_reviews.text: Finally a card that will shoot 4K in my Panasonic WXF991 without blurring frames. I downloaded my footage to the computer to Pinnacle HD22 program then exported to a bluray using MPEG2 format and it's perfect. Now I need a larger card the 128GB holds 3hrs and 55min. at 4K and a better program as the Pinnacle 22 is horrible for editing.
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best SD Cards I’ve Owned
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my Sony A7Rii which comes out to about 80mb per picture and I never have any lag time! Also works great in the video functions of my camera!
customer_reviews.author: Sam Kilman

customer_reviews.title: Be Aware.  It may fail you big time.
customer_reviews.text: Bough Bought a second one of these cards, just to have one set aside to use it when the moment arrives. A few days ago, I tried to use it with my Canon and it gave me an error. I wasn't able to access the card, format it, or nothing. I've tried EVERYTHING to make this work. Unfortunately, no success.So, be advise and know this card is the perfect way to waste $70+ Dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Speed test clocks the read / write speed at 70 and 80 mb/s. Return started.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with my Panasonic GH5/GH5s on all settings.
customer_reviews.text: This card (I have six of them now) works perfectly with my Panasonic GH5 and GH5s on all recording settings. It never stops, even at 10 bit, 400 All-I, and while set up to copy from one card to another. Don't blow your wad on some expensive, more well-known brand. It's NOT necessary! These cards are more than fast to handle whatever your Panasonic GH5/s can throw at it!
customer_reviews.author: A Rich

customer_reviews.title: added information in low light photos
customer_reviews.text: my findings under bright conditions was very little vs. other SD cards, but under low light photo the histogram had higher peaks and information on the photo much sharper. Will be using this Card for travel photography, and will report results if different from above
customer_reviews.author: John P

customer_reviews.title: Speed of this SD card is incredible.
customer_reviews.text: I take wildlife photography (primarily birds) and in many situations the SD card cannot keep up with the shutter speed - ultimately the camera grinds to a halt because the buffer is full. I have completely eliminated this problem with the Amplim 32GB UHS-II SDHC SD Card . Great price, great performance.
customer_reviews.author: faworange

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I am using this 64gb card in my Nikon D3500, we recently took it to the Valley of Fire and the R/W was impressive. A lot has to do with the setup of your camera and the type of pictures you are taking. R/W will be much different in some cases. Take that into consideration and dont always blame the SD Card. For a moderately educated photographer, this card is plenty for what you will be doing on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Rogers

customer_reviews.title: I have used 2 of these cards for my Sony ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used 2 of these cards for my Sony A7R Mk 3 and it has delivered what I expected. Write and transfer speeds is fast and have not had issues. If I am thinking about more SD cards, it will be these for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Wai K. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Fast and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I needed a fast SD card for my SLR camera. this card handled the fastest shooting with no problem
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: The memory card worked well in my camera. It was much faster than the old card and allowed for continuous picture shooting at for about 15 more pics (two times longer) before slowing. Even then the slowed down shooting was twice as fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The card works great. I only wish the laptop worked as well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my HP Stream that has only 32 GB of memory, not even enough to update hoping to be able to move enough programs to the sd card. The card works great. I only wish the laptop worked as well. Still won't update. I moved all the programs I could to the SD card.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative for backup cards.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these as 3rd and 4th backups for a second shooter. Also, I shoot with a Nikon D850. I spent a day giving them a good shakedown. For still photo purposes, this card is plenty fast. I shoot burst mode often and had no issues. I don't know about longevity, but for backup cards, these are a cheap alternative. I did not use them for video. So I cannot comment on their ability in that aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Baker

customer_reviews.title: It lasted about 3-4 rounds of shooting fine with up to All-Intra 4k
customer_reviews.text: It lasted about 3-4 rounds of shooting fine with up to All-Intra 4k, then started dropping frames at a mere 1080p30 422HQ (which my 95Mbps cards handle just fine)
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Lightening Fast Cards
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my new camera which shoots photos extremely quickly. These cards make the camera actually work the way it should!
customer_reviews.author: Clive Owens

customer_reviews.title: 400mbs for the gh5 with a catch
customer_reviews.text: I still recommend this card but it does create another file around the 38min mark when shooting all intra 400mbs.
customer_reviews.author: ShawnBNice

customer_reviews.title: works fast and fine
customer_reviews.text: While I haven't conducted read/write speed testing, and I've only run maybe 1500 images through it, it's worked fine in a camera that shoots 10 large images per second....and since that's what I needed, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: unkie

customer_reviews.title: Fast read SD card
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with this purchase. These fast read SD cards are exactly as advertised, allowing my camera to shoot image after image at incredible speed.
customer_reviews.author: James Rockafellow

customer_reviews.title: GH5 400mbs compatible!!!
customer_reviews.text: GH5 4K 400mbs confirmed compatible no write errors.. recorded up to 20 min with no issues.. could of went longer however I shut it off to save battery
customer_reviews.author: Jermel

customer_reviews.title: Speed and space
customer_reviews.text: Includes travel case Card works well with Sony A77ii and is a lot of speed and storage for just a little green. A trip to Best Buy revealed they don't even have a V90 SD card
customer_reviews.author: Not Owen

customer_reviews.title: It works great! A+
customer_reviews.text: Works great in my Fujifilm XT2. Absolutely no issues with either stills or HD video. Very fast card.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh

customer_reviews.title: Died without warning
customer_reviews.text: Shot for a week and a half an then it died - card error - can't salvage the footage. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Nagle

customer_reviews.title: Not what I thought it was
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't what I was looking for I thought all sd cards are micro sd cards
customer_reviews.author: Michael Higdon

customer_reviews.title: I purchase two originally and was so pleased with the performance in my LEICA VLUX and Canon ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchase two originally and was so pleased with the performance in my LEICA VLUX and Canon 5D Mark IV that I purchased two more so I would have a backup. The speed and 4K capability were well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: TechUser

customer_reviews.title: Successfully Record Panasonic GH5 400mb Files
customer_reviews.text: I bought this card specifically to record the Panasonic GH5's 4k 400mb files. The card successfully records the 400mb files without the recording stopping.
customer_reviews.author: lawrence mcfarrin

customer_reviews.title: I have not been disappointed. There have been no issues
customer_reviews.text: I had never heard of Amplim before this purchase, but after reading reviews about their products, I decided to give them a try. So far, I have not been disappointed. There have been no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Docwool

customer_reviews.title: A great card for Digital photography not for video recording
customer_reviews.text: Great little card for photo taking yet for 4K video recording at high specs please follow manufacturer’s recommendations this card surely falls short in that respect. ( Stutter playback )
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Card does exactly what AMPLIN advertises it to do!
customer_reviews.text: One of the fastest SDXC SD cards I have used. Very happy with this purchase. This is the third AMPLIN card I’ve purchased. Only sorry I didn’t do it sooner. This card far exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.author: Breyle

customer_reviews.title: Super fast no buffering
customer_reviews.text: Super fast! I upload photos and videos faster than I ever did before. I thought I had a slow computer, but the cards I was using were slow. I'm a pro photojournalist and there's zero buffering even at 8 frames a second!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Sabastian

customer_reviews.title: It's a beast
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Solved my 4k recording issues right away where two other brands that advertised the same couldn't. Good quality, good price point for what is being offered.
customer_reviews.author: PVFocus

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Records UHD 10bit 422 23.98fps just fine. Blackmagic Video Assist 7" 4K
customer_reviews.author: Greg A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good for 4K All intra 400Mbps H265
customer_reviews.text: 4K All intra 400Mbps H265 in Fujifilm XT3 this is the reason why I specifically bought the card and until now has done very well. No drop frames, reliable card and the price is a bit expensive but is worth it in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: TiagoAZ

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work pretty well. needed one that wrote faster. This seems to do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Eric ETop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great value and performance
customer_reviews.text: I have used this produce in the Costa Rician Rainforest and have had great success and performance.

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: very fast shooting and saving shooting RAW images. More space for more pictures!
customer_reviews.author: MARK KENNEDY

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased with the download speed of the chip.
customer_reviews.text: As I said I am very happy with the download speed of the chip.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Nowak

customer_reviews.title: As advertised. Took a few hundred pictures on vacation ...
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. Took a few hundred pictures on vacation and was impressed with the speed and quality. Can't say anything about longevity, though, since it's only been a month.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This product was highly recommended for our “nanny cam” setup. But it’s about 50x to big.
customer_reviews.author: BleuEyes

customer_reviews.title: Insert and start taking pictures.
customer_reviews.text: Inserted the cards and went right to taking photos. Couldn't have been easier. So far very pleased with this product.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great buy, I would buy again and recommend to others good price for the speed. Works in all my cameras, dslr and video.

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic EVA-2
customer_reviews.text: These work well allowing full function in my Panasonic Eva-2.

customer_reviews.title: shipped quick, good value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with the Canon EOS R, write speed approaches the SATA SSD in a SD card. Great price for the speed and capacity.

customer_reviews.title: Fast card for good value
customer_reviews.text: Fast write and read without lag on Sony A7iii. Good value compared to popular name brands.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I ordered. Will work great for my kid.

customer_reviews.title: It could not handle the transfer speed of the Sigma FP
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the more expensive Scandisk brand is what is needed, which is what was recommended. I thought I could do it on the cheap but I was wrong.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product and reasonable price by comparison.
customer_reviews.text: Have this to record video in my Sony a7iii. Is working out well so far.

customer_reviews.title: No case????!!!
customer_reviews.text: At this price, I expect a case for the SD card - LIKE EVERY OTHER BRAND GIVES YOU!!!!

customer_reviews.title: I use with a73 Sony
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the product came in record time and it's just what I need for what I'm doing

customer_reviews.title: Much faster than other SD cards I've used in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Much faster than other SD cards I've used in the past. Didn't want to fork out the extra cash, but it was worth it, will buy more soon.

customer_reviews.title: amazing fast
customer_reviews.text: Price was high but the quality and speed is amazing!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is working very good in my XT1 and XT20.

customer_reviews.title: very happy with this card

product_meta.title: Amplim 256GB UHS-II SDXC SD Card. Blazing Fast Read 282MB/S (1900X). Class 10 U3 Ultra High Speed V60 UHSII Extreme Pro SD XC Memory Card. 4K 8K Professional Video 256 GB / 256G TF Flash. New 2018
product_meta.description: Capacity:SD| Color:Gold 256GBFully compatible with SD 5.0 specifications. Available in 256GB (256 GB/ 256G), 128GB (128 GB / 128G), 64GB (64 GB / 64G) and 32GB (32 GB / 32G). HIGH PERFORMANCE BLAZING SPEED: 285MB/s transfer rate, UHS-II, V60, U3, Class10 for high performance next generation professional UHS-II compatible cameras and 4K camcorders. Professional 4K 3D HDR 360 Full HD Videos. MONEY BACK GUARANTEE: Purchase with Confidence! Amplim is a trusted brand. 30-Day Money Back Guarantee. RELIABLE & DURABLE: High quality 100% factory tested. Water proof, temperature proof, shock proof, X-ray proof and magnet proof. Eligible for Amazon Prime fast free shipping. New low profile retail packaging
feature_bullets: ULTRA HIGH PERFORMANCE SD CARD: Blazing speed 1900X (285MB/S) transfer rate. Twice the read speed of 1000X card. Newest SD Association SD 5.0 specs V60+ video rating provides 4K continuing shooting (other UHS-II cards without V ratings are last generation SD 4.0 cards). Top rated UHS-II U3 Class10 pro extreme turbo fast high capacity SD card for latest UHS-II SDXC (SD XC) compatible cameras, accessories, USB-C SD card reader, Microsoft Surface Book 2 and super fast 3D HDR 360 4K DSLR and 3D

PROFESSIONAL PHOTOGRAPHER MEMORY CARD: 32, 64 128 and 256 gig UHS-II high capacity cards for DSLR and Mirrorless UHS-II video Cameras (Sony, Fuji, Leica, Nikon, Olympus, Panasonic, Samsung). Sony Alpha A9 a7 a7R Mark III SF card Cyber-shot RX1R II; Fujifilm Fuji X-T1 X-Pro2 X-T2 GFX 50S X-H1 X-E3; Leica SL Typ 601 M10; Nikon D850 D500 FX; Olympus OM-D E-M5 II OM-D E-M10 II III PEN-F OM-D E-M1 Mark II; Panasonic Lumix DC-G9 GH5S GH5 GH4; Samsung NX1; Blackmagic URSA; Support all UHS-II devices

BACKWARD COMPATIBLE with UHS-I Cameras (Note: Speed of UHS-II card will be limited by the UHS-I SD slot): Sony Cyber-shot DSC W800 W830 DSCH300 Alpha a7R II DSC-RX10 IV a6500 a9 a6300 a99 II; Canon PowerShot SX720 SX730 SX530 HS ELPH 180 190 IS G7 X 5D Mark IV III II EOS 80D 5DS R Rebel T7i T6 T5 Kiss X70 X9 X9i 1300D 1200D M100 SL2 200D M56D M10 M677D 9000D 800D; Nikon Coolpix L32 L340 B500 D3400 D5300 D3300 D750 D7200 D7500 D5600 D5600

UHS-I COMPATIBILITY: Panasonic Lumix ZS50 DC G9 GX850 GX800 GF9 DMC-FZ2500 FZ2000 GX85 GX80 GX7 GH5 ZS60; Olympus PEN E-PL8 Tough TG-5; Fujifilm Fuji X100F X-E3 X-T20 X-E2S X-A3 X-A10 X100F X100T; Pentax K-1645Z KP K-70; Leica TL2 M10. This SD card does not need an adapter like 256GB, 128GB, 64GB or 32GB micro SD / microSD / microSDXC / microSDHC cards

4K AND 1080P CAMCORDERS: Panasonic HC-X920 WXF991K HC-X1000 hc-x1 VX-981K vc-870K V770K V800K VX1K WXF1K; Canon XF400 XF405 XA11 XA15 XC15 XA35 XA30 ViXIA HF G21 GX10 R82 R800 R80 R700 R70 G40 R72 mini X G20; Sony FDR AX700 AX53 AX33 AX100 CX900 VG30; JVC GY HM170 HM200 HM170U HM200U HM200SP HM200HW HM620U HM660U HM660SC HM850U HM890U HM650SC HM650U LS300U LS300CHU GZ R550 R550B R440B R440D GC PX100B R450B R320D R320B R70B R30B R10B R10A R10R, ETC.
